CatDescriptText: Mrs. J.M. Tidline, 916 N. Lang Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 21, 1958, pg.5 with question: "Do you think that the city needs a fair housing ordinance?" answer reads: �I think that it is good and needed because we should all learn to live together. We have the right to live together and that�s what we�re fighting for.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of J. M.Tidline, wearing dark jacket, light colored floral dress, eyeglasses, earrings, and necklace, holding dark handbag and light colored gloves in left hand, standing with young boy across from the Buhl Building with Fanny Farmer Candies, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
